text:
Many companies have foreign exchange risk arising from their cross-border transactions.
A Japanese company that expects to receive 10 million euros when a transaction is
completed in 90 days has yen/euro exchange rate risk as a result. By entering into a
forward currency contract to sell 10 million euros in 90 days for a specific quantity
of yen, the firm can reduce or eliminate its foreign exchange risk associated with the
transaction. When a firm takes a position in the foreign exchange market to reduce an
existing risk, we say the firm is hedging its risk.
